page.title: 18BOXFORD SCHOOL
page.content:
In 1984 the new extensions to Boxford School were completed. There only used to be two classrooms so some classes were in mobile classrooms on the playing field. We now have classrooms with adjoining activity areas. The extension had to be built so that it was in-keeping with the oldest part of the building which dates back to 1839. The school was remodelled because nearby Assington school was closed in 1984 and the children now come by bus to Boxford. Children also come by bus from Edwardstone and Groton.
Mr. Lowe has been the head teacher for eighteen years.
We have playing fields and we have a covered swimming pool which children from other schools can also use.
